text:
Steps to reproduce:
#0 Latest trunk 20171210, Ubuntu Linux with XFCE and Java 8:
java version "1.8.0_111"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_111-b14)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 25.111-b14, mixed mode)
#1 new thread group with HTTP Request
#2 add Boundary Extractor anywhere in the tree
#3 Click anywhere results in following stacktrace upon every subsequent click:
https://pastebin.com/Q5Tfrbww
creator: graham@ham1.co.uk
felix.schumacher@internetallee.de
text:
I can't reproduce this on ubuntu 16.04 with gnome shell using a current java 8 (1.8.0_151).

Can you try a current java 8?
Which LaF do you use?

Updated to
java version "1.8.0_151"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_151-b12)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 25.151-b12, mixed mode)

Still the same, using the new default Darcula.
creator: graham@ham1.co.uk

text:
Are you running JMeter inside a virtual machine?
I tested with Darcula and had no problems.
creator: felix.schumacher@internetallee.de

text: I restarted the VM and it's all ok now... must have been something to do with not rebooting after a kernel upgrade.
creator: graham@ham1.co.uk
